noun.description: A person who conducts trade independently of the restrictions or benefits of protective regulations.
Specifically. A trader who works independently of a company (as the East India Company, the Hudson Bay Company, etc.). Now historical.
A ship trading under licence to India independently of the old East India Company's Charter. Now historical.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Discourse Enlargement Trade. From free + trader, after free trade.
